Reviews.Title: “Ron @ Celia From Bonnie Dundee. Opinion Of Worst Dump On Earth.”
Reviews.Author: Ronald M
Reviews.Content: If this is the general standard of English,and more so,London Bed and Breakfast establishments,then,NO THANK YOU. This has to be the worst experience of a Bed and Breakfast Establishment, in my entire 62 years of living on this planet.I can `only speak for myself,and not my wife.As a Major Organ Transplant Recipient,and also a double below knee leg amputee,this is most certainly the last sort of establishment that i should within a mile of.My chances of catching an infection from this lot,was very very high.On arrival,we were asked to pay the remainder of our 2 night payment up front.We were then ushered into a back room,along beside the reception area.The first thing that met us,was an extremely vile,ghastly smell,from a burst main sewer pipe,directly outside our bedroom window.The toilet was no more disabled friendly than fly in the air.There was no room to open 2 suitcases,unless you used the top of the bed.No kettle in the room to make tea or coffee.There was not even 1 seat on view.But of course the room was too small for one, anyhow.Then there was the dangerous,steep, filthy,stairway,down into what they describe as the breakfast room.Quite frankly,our 2 wee staffy doggies eat in a far superior eating area, than what we had here.My wife asked for corn flakes.The young man who served us,must have emptied the entire contents into her bowl.He maybe thought that we were staying away from the premises for a month.She also asked for toast,which surprise, surprise,she is still waiting for,and we have been back home in Dundee now for 5 days.I asked for scrambled egg and toast.It was in front of me within a minute.This must be a world record.But alas,the bread was barely lukewarm,which can hardly be described as toast.The scrambled egg was barely edible.We were planning a 2 night stay,as we had laid down a deposit for it.But,we decided to head back to Bonnie Dundee,Pronto.I demanded a refund for the night we cancelled.After a bit of discussion with the receptionist,who eventually telephoned the owner,i was then handed the refund. What is even more unbelievable,is that Ex-Prime Minister,Tony Blair,lives within a stones throw from this pathetic place,with a 24 hour armed guard !! My advice to anyone planning to book up, in this run down premises,is,LOOK ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BillEIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice when travelling to London to go to concerts at Hyde Park. This hotel is in a perfect location for Hyde Park / Central London. The hotel is cheap and I'm afraid it seems quite run down, needs money spending on it to attract repeat business for people who need it for more than just sleeping in, which is all I needed. I would not recommend this hotel unless all you need is a great location and not bothered about size of rooms, or pristine cleanliness. On subsequent trips I have now found better hotels not far away in Sussex Gardens which are not much more expensive and definitely better run.

Reviews.Title: “Griffin house london- A complete tip!!”
Reviews.Author: wendi A
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!! It was absolutly filthy and grubby. There are 57 steps in the hotel which is completely useless for a disabled person like myself.When at the top of the narrow stairs to enter my room there was a decorators ladder blocking the passage way! Furthermore the road outside the hotel is extemely busy and hard to get across.The paint in the hotel was peeling and plaster was falling from the ceiling!! The webiste is very misleading as the hotel does not live up to the pictures posted and makes a false claim that the rooms have tea making facilities, which it does not! This hotel should be closed down by the trading standards, as in my eyes and i am sure in a lot of other previous guests eyes this hotel is not fit to be trading or putting up guests! J.A.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Best to avoid”
Reviews.Author: acLiLtocLiMB
Reviews.Content: We are small, but we couldn't move anywhere in the room without knocking into something. The bathroom must have the tiniest sink I've ever seen! We had the basement room - fabulous view (see photo)! Breakfast was until 09:30. 1st morning, we presented ourselves at 09:15. They weren't very happy. No sooner had they given us the breakfast (rather pitiful!) than we were told to hurry up! The 2nd morning, we went early, but we had to wait (they only had 3 tables!). Then, they had the cheek to tell us to hurry up again! When I told them it wasn't our fault that we had to wait, I was told to try to understand them! On the final morning, a guest obviously couldn't put up with the breakfast any longer, so he asked if he could have 3 cups of tea to bring up to his room. Well, the lady attending to him wasn't very happy, to say the least. The conversation, bordering on argument, lasted about 10 minutes! And the reason? They didn't have enough cups! Conclusion: Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Griffin House - more like doss-house”
Reviews.Author: LizFree
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from two nights stay in room 9!! Wish we had read reviews before we went. Felt slightly ill at ease when asked to pay balance on arrival at the somewhat scruffy reception - why oh why didn't I ask to see the room first!!! This "hotel" is absolutely dire - I hope they use our Â£85 per night charge to buy a new bed and some desperately needed paint. I take issue with some of the reviews which justify the disgusting conditions at this hotel because it is cheap - firstly I don't think it was cheap and secondly soap and water don't cost much so there is no excuse for this hotel to be so dirty. The only reason we stayed was because the sheets were clean and we were only there for a very short space of time. Furniture was old, grubby and damaged - we didn't even unpack - as the drawers were very grubby inside. Paint and plaster coming off the walls dirt on the skirting boards inches thick, the bedside lamp was vile - even after a shower you felt grubby due to the surroundings. There were no tea and coffee making facilities - probably just as well really!!! We used the deli on the corner for a late cuppa. Looked into the breakfast room on the first morning but turned tail and preferred to go and pay for breakfast - bit annoying really when you have already paid for it. Second morning decided to brave breakfast - well cup of tea really before heading off. When I say cup of tea I mean half a cup of hot water with tea bag on the side - no pot or top ups here - half a cup that's your whack. A bowl of pre-poured cornflakes was planted in front of my daughter (you didn't even have portion control) and two slices of "toast" was plonked in front of me - don't expect a toast rack or your toast in nice triangles. Don't expect "would you like anything else, is everything ok for you" - they don't ask because they really, really don't want the answers!!! It's location is extremely good and for London the price is competitive, however I have stayed in places far cheaper with excellent breakfast, friendly staff and delightful rooms - there is no excuse for this place - it is an absolute disgrace, Big Issue sellers would turn their noses up at this one. Come on Griffin House - clean up your act and give your guests a decent experience - you put London and the rest of the UK to utter shame. You should be ashamed of yourselves what an impression to give travellers - disgraceful. DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER HOW DESPERATE YOU ARE - THIS PLACE IS JUST AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: davidp1012
Reviews.Content: very small dark room, room was dirty and smelly, shower was hanging of the wall, loose broken tiles on floor and walls. Needs updating. Electric sockets not working would advise anybody not to stay here, or you will regret it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Will never stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: Sherri3708
Reviews.Content: The room was on the 3rd floor without a lift, which was ok but the higher you climbed the smaller the steps became. The shower looked like it had never been cleaned, there was alot of mold and the glass doors hadn't been touched this year. The floor looked as though they couldn't drag the cleaner up those steps so they didn't bother. The paint was peeling off in chucks from the walls and the ceiling looked like it was going to come crumbling in due to the water damage. The TV didn't work correctly so we said something to the night and day clerk, both stating that they would have someone look at it but it never was resolved. We got up early and stayed out late due to the fact that we didn't want to go to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheRough
Reviews.Content: Staff are slow and lazy, despite there being only 15 rooms the girl behind the counter could not find our reservation for over 15 minutes. I almost wish she'd refused our stay. The breakfast is shambolic and to be avoided at all costs. I asked for a piece of toast and was flatly refused! The place stinks - very musty and clearly isn't cleaned to any high standard. The bathroom was full of mould and mildew, and the shower leaked terribly. Wallpaper on the walls was coming off, which was in keeping with the general ill state of repair. Beds are dire, as are the rooms. Only stay at this hotel if you are a young person who is planning on getting so drunk it doesn't matter where you sleep. I never write reviews but simply had to after staying in this dive. Please avoid this place - it's cheap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “complete dump, avoid”
Reviews.Author: optare
Reviews.Content: stayed in this dump on the 28th of april for two nights.wascharged Â£300 for the priveledge, filthy rooms, cramped. it should be investigated and closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Falty Towers Theme Hotel or Just the Worse Hotel in London?”
Reviews.Author: KitMM
Reviews.Content: Booking a room at the Griffin House Hotel from my home in Australia, I imagined from the description a small cosy B&B, with some cute but nice rooms, a filling breakfast and free wireless internet. After all, for 70 quid a night, it would be quite reasonable to expect â€˜niceâ€™. You donâ€™t get â€˜greatâ€™ or even â€˜goodâ€™ in London for less than 120 a night. Iâ€™ve stayed in many hotels over the years. Some cost a lot less than the Griffin House and were virtually five-star apartments (The Salisbury Hotel on 57th Street in New York is amazing), others cost a lot less and were hideous (The Globe Hotel, Oswiecim, Poland begs some politically incorrect comparisons with the former death camp across the railway line). But the Griffin House Hotel takes the Golden Turd in the All-Time Overpriced Dump category. When I checked into the Griffin House and was struck by the profound sourness of the staff. Since I decided to give up living in Britain during the Thatcher tyranny, a kind of officious and humourless pseudo-customer-service has emerged, where you the customer are told youâ€™re very important yet treated as an undeserving cretin with the audacity to be giving them money. But the Griffin House staff have entered a new Superleague of crapulence in the arena of customer f***-you-ness. I paid for my two nights on arrival and was given the key to my room â€œdown the stairs and next to the Breakfast Roomâ€�. In the basement? Yes, in the basement. The room was so small that the bedside tables were across from the creeky double bed, since there was virtually no room either side. The walls were stained by a tide-mark of damp rising from the floor. The shower was in a cupboard. Yes, a cupboard shower. Its nozzle bracket hung loosely from the wall, and when I took a shower the floor quickly with filled with water around my ankles. The toilet cupboard was fitted with a motion-detector air freshener, that spat Glade at me every time I entered the room, and if I dared move while sitting on the seat. Donâ€™t take too long having a dump â€“ youâ€™ll come out smelling like a disinfectant cake. The signal for the free wireless internet was unserviceably weak. I complained, nicely, and was told I could get a better signal in the Breakfast Room next door. But I was then questioned by other staff about what I was doing loitering there. â€œWhat room are you from?! What room are you from?!!!â€� The view from my window was the window of the kitchen, six inches away, which lit up 6:30am every morning and emanated with the clanging of pots. The first morning I just wanted the hell out of the Hotel, so I avoided the free breakfast in the Breakfast Room and ate at the Pret a Manger near Marble Arch. The second morning, however, I thought, hey, what the hell, itâ€™s paid for, I might as well get something for my 70 quid a night. And, I have to say, this decision it worth every single penny. I was treated to a new and unaired episode of Falty Towers. It was truly hilarious. I took a seat at one of the three four-seater tables (a curious choice of seating, giving that the hotelâ€™s rooms are either singles or doubles). The cook/waitress/entertainment came out of the kitchen to take my order. I had Option 1 or Option 2, the basic difference being eggs or cereal, and the choice of tea, coffee or hot chocolate. Could I order a black coffee? The milk is on your table, of course, the coffee comes out black. And how dare I ask such a ridiculous question. Since the coffee I ordered never showed up, they could have got away with spoiling me so much for choice anyway. I was distracted from my scrambled eggs by a French woman and her two daughters entering the Breakfast Room at 9:40am. The cook/waitress ordered â€œSit! Sit...! Come on...! SIT! We stop serving at 10am...! Sit or you wonâ€™t get anything!â€� The party of three was coerced to sit across two different tables, the kids looking quite distressed and intimidated. Their order was taken with the same minus-scale level of respect I had experienced. Then the cook/waitress brought out three glasses of orange juice and slammed them down in front of each diner as though she was closing an auction. I was expecting next a large pot of gruel and Mr Bumble shouting â€œMORE?!â€� It would have been hilarious had the kids not have been trembling. I can just imagine what they would say when they get back to Lille or Paris or Lyon and tell their friends and family about the â€œtres merdeâ€� time theyâ€™d had in London. Since Iâ€™ve stayed at the Salisbury Hotel in New York, Iâ€™ve told so many people about it, and I know friends have told their friends, and so that placeâ€™s reputation will only grow and it will get more clients. The staff at the Griffin House just do not get this. I mean, who cares if youâ€™ve had a crap time in their dumpy hotel, when thereâ€™s still plenty of suckers out there, like I was, who read the misleading description of the hotel, think they might be getting 70 quid of hotel value and are duped into booking. Just after I checked out, I went for a pint at the pub on the corner, the Duke of Kendal. The barmaid asked where Iâ€™d been staying and we had a conversation about what a thoroughly crap time Iâ€™d had at the Griffin. â€œOh! I wonâ€™t recommend anyone stays there then...!â€� she said. And that too is why Iâ€™m writing this review. Just generally, if you get a bad vibe about a place when you arrive, ask to see the room *before* you pay anything. But more specifically, please save yourself the feeling of being ripped-off, abused and imprisoned in a basement and avoid the Griffin House Hotel. In short, I have three things to say about the Griffin House: 1. Do not stay at this hotel. 2. Do not stay at this hotel. 3. And do NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: JudeAkron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the last minute after my flight was cancelled due to snow. They said breakfast would be served until 9:30 but at 9:15 was told it was over and had been put away! The reservations neglected to mention that, although the room had its own shower and sink I had to share a toliet! One night was one too many!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad as other reviews imply!!”
Reviews.Author: raisEurope
Reviews.Content: Okay its true that the breakfast is not great, the breakfast room is also tiny but Griffin House Hotel has got a great location, just a stone's throw away from all the hustle & bustle. The area is very safe even at night & the two reception ladies are adorable especially the foreign one! Can't say the same about the male one though! The room & bathroom are small but very cosy. Many of the reviews here are old from when the hotel was under previous management so please ignore the old reviews!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: swedishfamily95
Reviews.Content: Very small room with dirty carpets,torn wallpaper and a cracked floor in the bathroom. Extremely thin walls so every noice froom neighbours was heard. Was kept awake for two nights in a row due to very noicy machinsounds and loud voices from next door. Called the reception several times and did not get any help there. The breakfast was eatable but not more. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Christinehewitt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel very last minute, thought the position was great and it looked good. After I booked it, I read all the reviews on this site.. and there were many, and got increasingly concerned.. a vast proportion of the reviews were terrible, frankly. But I thought, hey ho, I;ve booked it now. The area where this is is just impossibly posh... Tony Blairs London home is a hundred yards away, and, therefore, the street is patrolled by armed police, 24/7. Now, you may hate this idea, but I found it reassuring as a single lady, and they were sweet and friendly, despite the machine guns... the hotel itself was shabby, yes, but for the price I paid, I wasn;t complaining. 3 nights, height of season, in a hotel a stones throw from Hyde Park, with a shower, sky tv, internet access, and breakfast..... Â£130 all in.... I will definately use it again. The room was clean, and serviced every day. Tiny, yes, I hadn't realised till then exactly how much space a pair of shoes could take up in a room, but, like I say, I'm never going to live there, and it suited me down to the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a night stay”
Reviews.Author: mytrips17
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed there for 1night. I paid GBP49 for a single room so I wasn't expecting the moon. Yes, the place is dated, needs painting, room is old fashioned, small and furniture needs replacing but mine was cleaned. Shower was cleaned and working well with good water pressure, toilet cleaned, bed sheet cleaned, mattress comfy enough. The room had an hair dryer which I didn't expect! Area is secured with Tony's Blair residence almost opposite with guards outside all night. Breakfast was small and not fancy but if you ask you get more and the lady was very polite. The receptionist was friendly and helpful with coverage all night so I didn't need to take the chunky key with me. This is all I needed for 1 night. If the place was all perfect you'll pay 4/5 times more considering the location! I needed something cheap as I was paying :) and had a late night out planned in Central London and needed few hours sleep before an early meeting close to the area. I travel the world a lot for work mainly and tend to be the fussy type but, sometimes, for what you pay, you have to be fair. You can't expect a 5 star hotel facilities at this price in Central London. At least what I needed was fine and I had a good welcome! Yes, the owners should put much more attention to the place, this is a golden plot! Personally, I 'll go back for a night stay in the future. I wasn't there to admire the room and the hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: sptl
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to say that after reading very bad reviews about the hotel in tripadvisor we still pushed it and went ahead and booked the Griffin House (mainly because of the price) As soon as we arrived to the hotel and were greeted by a very rude girl who showed herself as the receptionist, the first things that got our attention was the very poor painting on the walls (most of them torn apart) and the tremendous stench that filled the hotel. We walked into our rooms to find ourselves inside a very different room to the ones showed in the hotel's website, we asked for a change, we were told nothing was available. I won't even want to talk about the bathrooms, small as possible, water came out dirty, and everything smelled as sewage. I have travelled many times to london (and many many many european cities and towns), many of them in a budget and believe me, this has been by far the worst stay in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for location. Clean & Comfy with Sky & Breakfast. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: robagsgrady
Reviews.Content: I cant understand what everyones on about in the earlier reviews! Maybe the hotel owners have had a spruce up since. I was nervous because of the reviews but it was the best I could get in that area at a budget price. I had no reason to worry! Alright its a small double room with small bathroom but perfectly adequate and very clean with new modern sheets and sky and a fan for a weekend trip. I wanted near hyde park with our own bathroom (many hotels were charginh more for a shared bathroom!) and I got it for a reasonable price (Â£170 for two nights with breakfast) The breakfast room is tiny and breakfast isnt big and a bit limited for my appetite but absolutely perfect scambled eggs - not microwaved! Also this is a VERY safe and secure place as Tony Blair lives literally across the road and has 24 hour armed guards! All in all a very pleasant stay. Would definately recommend this place if only for the short walk to Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Belinda56
Reviews.Content: I may have stayed in a worse hotel, but I sincerly can't remember when. The room was very, very small (which wouldn't have been so bad) had the plaster not been peeling off the walls, the television so small and so high up you couldn't see it, and the bed being so old that you could feel every spring poking you in the back. Oh, and the shower flooding the bathroom when you took a shower, which was smaller than a phone booth. Had we been staying longer we would have moved to a different hotel. Thank goodness we were only there 2 nights and except for sleeping (which we got little of) we never were in the room. Terrific location though, I just wish they would invest in a little paint and some fixing up.

Reviews.Title: “Flophouse”
Reviews.Author: dovsky
Reviews.Content: PLUS: Friendly personnel. Very good location: all main tourist attractions are in walking distance, there are a lot of different shops, department stores, groceries, arab greengroceries and greasy moneychangers, oodles of shawarma and narghile bars, facias in arabic and pharsi language. The place is relatively secure: 2-3 policemen keep vigil 24h/7d right in front of the hotel. MINUS: The rooms are repulsively tiny, no table, no chair, no stool, there is no place even to put a single suitcase (we took two rooms: "Deluxe Double", #12, and "Standard Double", #9, - the difference was only in lopsided commode with clutched cases in "luxury" room). There is not enough space in toilet/shower to wipe yourself, even to place soap and shampoo. THERE IS NO COFFEE/TEE MAKER in the room, despite the hotel's advertisements. The TV has only free channels: basic news and vulgar sexual advertisements. The breakfast is ridiculously small: 1 tea or coffee, 1 toast+jam, 1 egg or flakes. It is very strange that such flophouse is declared as three-star hotel (e.g., EasyToBook.com where I booked it), I think that even one star is too much for it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed & fast break”
Reviews.Author: Robbo1968
Reviews.Content: Having booked one night B & B, we arrived at this "hotel" for a little R & R. We checked into room 9 & were amazed to find a room that had a bed the size of the room. There was a little space between the bed & the bathroom but that was it. I had to climb over my wife to get to the bathroom because walking around the bed was impossible. Having survived our night, we looked forward to breakfast, it could be as bad as the room could it? Yes it could!! We looked at the breakfast menu. Option 1. One egg & toast with no taste was breakfast. We asked whether we could get any bacon etc. but to no avail. The girl just repeatedly asked "How eggs?" (No, that isnt my mistake, it's how she asked) Option 2 was cereal

Reviews.Title: “be aware of hanging/ trailing wires....and that's just to start!”
Reviews.Author: devilred
Reviews.Content: My my.... what a place, and i sincerely wish I meant that in a good way! After finding the hotel, which was central to Marble Arch and pretty much ideal, our group of 5 arrived to check in and our reservation had been messed up, instead of a triple and 2 singles (this was all they had available at time of booking) we had been reserved a double and 2 singles. The best they could offer was to put a 'camp bed' into the double room (i suggested the possibility of upgrading a single to another double and was met with a very un- friendly huff). Seeing as we had no- where else to go and needed to be at a theatre show for the evening, we agreed. No lift and 3 flights of stairs later- 1 flight to the top floor was steep and very un-forgiving with suitcases and wearing heels, we arrived to our rooms. The 'now' triple was cramped and to get into bed you had sit at the bottom of the bed and crawl up, the bathroom door was off the hinges, cracked tiles and a sink you could barely wash your face in. One single was not actually that bad, except the shower knob came off in your hand and the other single room was hysterical... a shower in the cupboard (literally), wires hanging from the tv around the satellite box (that fell off onto me) leads across the floor and of course the bag over the smoke alarm. Receptionist as apologetic as ever... yeah right! Didn't even attempt to try and figure out what was on the breakfast menu! Thank goodness we were only staying for 1 night... oh, and for great friends that made the whole escapade hysterically amusing and a great night out!

Reviews.Title: “It was so terrible it was funny!”
Reviews.Author: jellycat31
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel with a group of friends only to find that they had made a mistake with the booking and has reserved the wrong rooms. As a result, they put up an extra camp bed in one of the rooms to acommodate the 'roomless' person! Once gaining access to the rooms, we noticed that there was considerable damage to doors, furniture, showers and trailing dangerous wires hanging down and accross the rooms from electrical equipment. In addition to this, the rooms were dirty and could have done with a lick of paint rather than the less than important installation of satellite TV boxes! On pointing out these problems to hotel staff, my friend was met with indifference! ...We didn't even try the breakfast! Check out their website, it doesn't even look like the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: applepipSurrey
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel had allocated the wrong rooms for our party of five. The receptionist was less than helpful and made no apology for their error. They managed to fit another 'bed' into the twin room and discounted the cost of the room by Â£5. When we got to the room they had put a camp bed between the two singles, there was no space to actually get into the bed unless you crawled up the bed from the bottom end. The rooms themselves were poorly funished and very knocked about. There were mutiple faults with the room e.g. door off the hinges, sharp cracked bathroom tiles, wires stretched across the rooms and plastic bags tied around the smoke detectors. When I returned to the reception to make the staff aware of the faults they said that they were already aware, but again offered no apology. Luckily our party were only staying one night and we spent minimal time at the hotel. I would strongly advise that people avoid staying here. The hotels website is very misleading and the room are not recognisable against the photos they have used on their web page. The hotel is in a good central location and is relatively cheap but still offers very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive HOSTEL”
Reviews.Author: Trawellista
Reviews.Content: The three of us stayed for two nights. And I wish I would have read the reviews before I booked - never mind. Locating the hotel was a piece of cake no problem there the location is very very convenient BUT that is the only possitive about this place. The rooms are the size of a penny, the single room has a shared toillet in the hallway, itÂ´s noisy and breakfast is a total myth. This is closer the a hostel then a hotel which makes is rather expensive and not at all enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly dreadful”
Reviews.Author: guineapigNottingham
Reviews.Content: I emplore you... if you pay attention to any review on trip advisor in relation to the Griffin House Hotel, let it be mine. Don't give this hotel a chance! Pay a tenner more, book early and stay in a Travelodge. Yuck. Pictures on their website are completely inaccurate. The only hotel with vacancies on London Marathon weekend, and with good reason!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean and close to london attractions”
Reviews.Author: Karlinoz31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at griffen house hotel, it is colse to all attractions and Marble arch tube station, Rooms are small but have everything you need. Breakfast was not the best but there are cafes in walking distance which do breakfast. For the price i think this is a great stay. But you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A travellerâ€™s nightmare”
Reviews.Author: WatsonDevon
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™d love to provide you with a full review of the Griffin House Hotel experience but I can only take you as far as the reception, as thatâ€™s as far as we gotâ€¦despite a confirmed booking with the Griffin House Hotel, we found ourselves in London on a Saturday with no accommodation. My friends and I booked 2 rooms with the Griffin House hotel over a month in advance of our trip, we called a week before arrival to make an amendment to the booking and confirm our reservation. However, upon our arrival the thoroughly unhelpful lady behind the reception (I use the term loosely) not-so-politely informed us that â€˜our names werenâ€™t on the list so we werenâ€™t coming inâ€™. This is despite the fact that we could provide written confirmation of our booking. Defying the tradition of customer is always right, the lady behind the desk blankly informed us that the hotel was full and our predicament was not her fault. After some huffing and puffing she finally presented us with two equally under whelming options; we could have our 2 rooms, in 2 different hotels, 2 blocks apart at a much higher cost than our original reservation or we could leave a message for the manager who wouldnâ€™t be back at work till Monday, 2 days after our expected departure. Needless to say we declined both. If youâ€™re planning a trip to the Griffin House Hotel my advice would be have a plan B!

Reviews.Title: “Nice , warm and cheap solution!!!”
Reviews.Author: ftylos30
Reviews.Content: The room is small but warm enough and provides all comforts for somebody that wants a cheap and simple solution in London. The bathroom is quite big and it always has hot water. The breakfast is simple but very tasty and well cooked. The staff is very friendly and willing to give you all the information that you need.the location of the hotel is excellent. it's near the central artery of subway, bus stations,hyde park and oxford street. The neighbourhood that surrounds it, is so beautiful and calm that fascinates you. In general lines is a very good solution for those who want to travel cheaply in London. Sure we will revisit it. Thank you for the excellent time that we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “dirtiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: kromjong
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel ever i have stayed in mould and damp every where would not reccomend or stay here again

Reviews.Title: “More than awful....but they don't care!”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place! It is a dump. I doubt that this place could possibly meet any industry health and safety regulations. The location is good, but that is not enough. If this accommodation cost a quarter as much as it did, it would still be far too expensive. For an extra 50 GBP per night, for a triple room, we found a beautiful 'luxury' hotel metres from Paddington station, including full English breakfast! So look carefully....read all of these comments....I wish I had! Like so many others, we had a horrible stay. We booked and paid for a triple room. We arrived very late at night and could not look for alternative accommodation. The room is no.3. It was disgusting to say the least. It was in the basement next to their kitchen. Tiniest of rooms, could not move. Three people could not even stand up at one time, the floorspace was so small. Worse than this the walls were damp and mouldy with peeling wallpaper. The double bed and single bed (a makeshift trundle-type of structure) had stained linen. The dirty shower was literally in a cupboard and stank of mould. The toilet was dirty and unflushed. I could go on and on about one awfully tiny revolting space. We e demanded a full refund for the two nights booked, but they don't care. We left as early as possible the next morning, not daring to eat food from there. and after much following-up and argument, we received a refund for the second night's booking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst London Hotel Ever - Watch your belongings”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlon
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend that if you value your personal belongings you reconsider staying at this property. On arrival I wanted to have a shower, the shower on full power wasn't enough to even fill a glass of water let alone to bathe under. After asking for this to be fixed I tried again a few hours later with no change. Again on my way out I asked for the shower to be fixed, again no result or care for my request. I had no choice but to go without a shower for 2 days. On checking out I left an expensive shirt in the waredorobe of which I shortly can back to collect once I realized I had left it behind. The man on reception said that he and ''the cleaner'' on inspection of the room could not find my shirt. I asked to see in the room and not to my surprize my shirt was no longer hanging up. We asked to fill in a lost property form or a stolen good form but there was no such process in exhistance for this occurance. It was clear to me this ''hotel'' run a strict ''Finders Keepers'' service with no regard to there patrons in any way shape or form Keep Away !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Pollywollywoo
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room and were given the room downstairs next to the dining area. The window was directly opposite to the hotel kitchen windows so it was noisy in the morning. The room was far too small for a triple. There were large damp patches all over the walls; paint was peeling from the ceiling; the shower room was too small to stand up in and was full of mould and smelt awful. The lock on the toilet door was broken; the toilet made an awful rumbling noise when flushed; toilet paper was slightly soggy from damp; the shaving light fitting was smashed; the bin was broken; dangling electrical cables and frayed edges from the carpet were a trip and safety hazard. The room was so awful that it warrants a letter of complaint to trading standards and health and safety officials. We overheard other guests complaining about their rooms over breakfast (which was ok but by no means 'continental'). I wish we had taken photos to evidence the appalling state of the place. Would definitely not stay here again or recommend this to anyone whose friendship we value.

Reviews.Title: “keep away from the Griffin”
Reviews.Author: shocks33600
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms nothing like web site suggests-booked 2x twin rooms en-suite but on arrival offred 1x twin which was damp and wall paper hanging off wall and 2x singles with toliets outside room on landing in a cupboard under the stairs !! Refused rooms as not as booked-they refused to refund my deposit and then without authorisation took a further payment from my credit card-police and tradings standards now investigating- keep away

Reviews.Title: “It's fine”
Reviews.Author: nler
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor reviews are becoming more troubling. You can't figure out what really is going on. I start to think there is something more wrong with the reviewer than with the hotels. Griffin is a budget hotel -- on a quaint street, next to some great places in London. If it weren't for places like Griffin i'd have nowhere in London to stay. I paid 50 pounds for a basement room. It was clean. The towels were a bit worn; the sheets not amazingly comfortable. But i slept fine and I engaged with friendly staff. That's what i expected. Sometimes i think other guests expect so much for such a comparatively small price. This place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this dump”
Reviews.Author: vermaak
Reviews.Content: Room are tiny.Showers have mould.Bed is terribe.Everything bad everybody said before me is true .

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away Please!”
Reviews.Author: IloveLondonmore
Reviews.Content: Please stay away from this hotel. I stayed in a single room that was supposedly an en-suite. This meant a very small shower cubicle with a door you couldn't open without bumping into the tv. The toilet was a shared one in the corridor. The room was very small even for London and smelled really badly. I have stayed in a lot of hotels but have never felt so cheated before.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, you can book better!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSnowGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not the best place to stay. It is located in a very central area, but the hotel itself is no good. The double room we booked was extremely small with the bed taking up most of the space. The matrass was very old and I could feel the base of the bed. The bathroom is smaller than small with the wash basin tucked away in the one corner and hardly wide enough to wash your face in. The towels were really old and over used. There wasn't even complimentary shampoos or anything! The sky-box cables were haning lose and looked terrible. The room was located on the street and was so noisy I had to use earplugs! The breakfast room was just as bad. It it located in the basement and very warm and stuffy. Not a friendly breakfast feel to it with staff that could hardly understand what I asked for in English. It was suppose to be a continental breakfast but I was terribly dissapointed. All in all, you can find a better place to stay at that is even a bit cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: corksika
Reviews.Content: I was so sorry that I did'nt read the trip advisor review on this place before I booked it. I refused the first room which was seperated from the reception cubicle by light partition wall. The room was so small that the bed took up 90% of the entire space. The second room wasn't much better, it was in the basement and it and it was dingy, depressing, musty and damp. The walls and carpet were filthy and I thought it best to wash dowm the shower before using it. I'm not a fussy person and I did'nt mind the complete lack of facilities but I do expect a place to be clean. It's an absolute dump!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful B&B Hotel for stay”
Reviews.Author: ChoeGambline
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed on 25th September,2007 at Griffin House Hotel Marble Arch 10 Connaught street.This is one of the most beautiful B&B place all most famous attractions are very near and all staff was very helpful and smile facing., I recommend this to any and everybody! Let's just say that the back to normal now!! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “not for families with small children!”
Reviews.Author: no7helena
Reviews.Content: Had to go to London at short notice and booked this hotel as it was in a convenient location for us. As we were travelling with a baby and a toddler, both in pushchairs, our choice didn't turn out to be great as it was difficult to get to our room due to very narrow stairs, doorways and corridors (there was no lift either). The rooms were quite small, especially the bathrooms, for example there was approximately a 35 cm gap between the door and the shower cubicle that anyone who wanted to use the toliet or sink had to squeeze through. The standard of the room was OK but not great, maybe what can be expected from a two star hotel. We'd booked a triple room which turned out to have a problem so inseted we were given two adjacent rooms (double + single). OK but less convenient than all of us being together. The TV took some effort go get working as the Sky box was disconnected On the plus side the staff was friendly and helpful and the location is great in a very central location but still in a very quiet street. Overall good for someone who values location over comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trinihoney
Reviews.Content: They made me pay in full on arrival without even seeing the room, then the room was so full of a mildew smell my allergies immediately acted up and could not stay in that room. The room was under street so no fresh air. The sheets looked and smelt even worse, and the bathroom was a 'closet' with loads of mildew on the roof of it as it had no air in it... GROSS! After telling that I couldn't stay there, they told me no other rooms were available and that I couldn't have a refund. I paid for a room for 5 nights and couldn't even stay there. Don't stay here!
